summary: This week I migrated our internal TODO list to GitHub Issues and built a pipeline to turn those into tasks automatically. I also wired up health checks for the blog engine through a Durable Object and fixed a handful of status page quirks, like how it handles maintenance mode.

features: add "What is Firefly?" knowledge base article (#444)
add GitHub issue templates and automation workflows
add landing component to auto-label workflow
add GitHub Issues task management functions
add BATS test suite for issue functions
add grove-issues skill for bulk TODO-to-issue pipeline
fixes: sync subscriber count to 67 on roadmap and plant pages (#440)
inline vineyard components to fix npm resolution
standardize favicon SVGs with circular background (#441)
add dark mode text color overrides for readable content (#443)
remove Meadow, add Payments maintenance mode
update README logo path and project name
move midnight bloom article to philosophy category (#446)
raise latency thresholds to prevent false alerts
route API health check through engine service binding
add lattice to GroveTool Record objects
use toArray instead of one() for config lookup
use toArray instead of one() in deployed DO worker
overhaul auto-label workflow to prevent over-tagging
refactoring: single source of truth for TenantDO implementation
migrate task tracking from TODOS.md to GitHub Issues
docs: add repository snapshot and release summary for v0.9.90
add "What is the Midnight Bloom?" knowledge base article (#445)
tests: widen debounce test timing margins to prevent flakiness
